column2: fairiegurl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: I have been having trouble sleeping for about a year(no idea why). I have tried every otc sleeping pill i can find, and discovered that 98% of them are a benadryl(diphenhydramine) base....Also have tried the "natural" ones, with absolutely NO effect at all...the benadryl ones only work if i take a large dose, but I then get horrible "restless leg syndrome" which affects my arms and hands as well....so ill stick to one or two benadryl for my seasonal allergies(takes me about 5 of them to get sleepy)....Then I discovered that Unisom comes in two kinds....diphenhydramine(benadryl), and doxylamine....I tried the doxylamine - walmart brand....worked wonderful for about a week....took one tablet before bed, and other that taking about an hour or so to kick in, it worked great.....Now im up to taking 3 to get sleepy at all, and it takes about an hour and a half even for that.....Im sure taking too many is risky, but not sure at what point i should stop upping the dose for it to be effective...Anyone know? I have not tried any prescription sleeping pills yet, but I am about ready to because I am so dissapointed in the otc ones.....

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
grandpa phil, 55-64 Male  (Patient)
column9: I've had chronic insomnia 4 close to 20 yrs. (lots of stress in my life),& taken diff't meds.4 most of that time. Unisom works but THE KEY IS THE DOSAGE, which also VARIED 4 me over time. At 1st, 1/2 a pill was too much, leaving me groggy next day. As I developed tolerance over the yrs, had 2 go up to 1 or 1-1/2. Reading other user comments, I C some ppl complaining that 1/2 pill leaves them groggy, others say they need 1 to 1-1/2. The long term users (like me) seem to say they take more. So the import't thing's to GET THE DOSAGE RITE!   Ambien also works 4 me, but it's only DESIGNED for 4 HRS. My Dr. said if U wake up, take another. Then they made Ambien CR, which works great for 8 hrs. 4 me, but requires a prescriptn, ins. co. limits it, & co-pays EXPENSIVE. Unisom's cheap & easy 2 get.   Benadryl works 4 me 2, but only for 3-4 hrs. Lunesta doesn't work, Restoril used to, but stopped as i developed tolerance.   It's comforting to see i'm not alone w/ chronic insomnia! Gd luck!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medication about 3 or 4 times a week for about a year. I take one half tablet. It does work, does not leave me groggy in am and I sleep about 8 hrs. The only problem I find is after taking it for a couple of days, about 10-12 hrs after taking it I am very grouchy. The grouchiness subsides after about 3 hrs, but during that 3 hrs. I am a "bear". I do not take it on the weekends at all because my husband is home then and I will bite his head off over nothing. During the week, by the time he gets home, I'm fine.

column2: GrandmaShaw, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have had problems sleeping for as long as I can remember. I usually feel groggy the next day but have learned to live with the hangover effect since it's the only way I can get any sleep. Occasionally, I'll be up all night and then realize the next day that I didn't take a pill before bed. On rare occasions, I will still be up all night even though I've taken a pill. I have taken one 25 mg. pill every night for about the last ten years now and have tried to wean myself off without success.  I usually throw in the towel after about three fitful nights of not sleeping and go back in desperation for some sleep.

column2: read73, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years
column9: About 11 years ago I was diagnosed with hiatal hernia, acid reflux & "non-cardiac" chest pain and have had trouble sleeping ever since.  I've recently developed chronic shoulder & back pain. I used to take a generic benadryl sleep aid but found that it caused an odd heaviness in my legs.  I take the Walmart brand Doxylamine Succinate 25 mg and it knocks me out.  It seems I build up a resistance verily easily and if I take it more often than every other night it just doesn't work.  Every third night works great.  Fortunately I have a flexible schedule because lately I can sleep 12 hours at a time.  But that helps to make up for the "off" nights when I sleep only a few hours or not at all.  I do wake up groggy and dry-mouthed even after 12 hours sleep, but coffee takes care of that. Overall I am happy with the medication.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I use this medication at bedtime for occas. sleeplessness. It is very strong at 25mg., in my case, so I cut the tablet in thirds. This results in my taking about 9mg. dose. It is very effective at helping me sleep all the way through the night.  My only complaint is that it can cause sleepiness the next day if take more than 1/3 of a 25mg. tablet or if I use it more than 2 nights in a row.  I don't recommend using this product more than 2 or 3 nights a week and to counteract any sleepiness the next day with caffiene (coffee/tea) early on as driving or using machinery could be dangerous.  Drinking coffee in the morning usually dispells any drowsiness in my case. I do not normally drink coffee everyday.

column2: Up at night, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started with just a half of a pill, now I have to take two. Othrwise it wouldn't work at all. I developed such tolerance to this drug in just a few months. DO NOT TAKE IT WITH ALCOHOL!!! It makes you feel awfull next morning!I hope its safe for long term use because out of all sleep aids on the market prescription or over-the-counter this one doesn't make me feel too miserable in the morning and is effective. But if I have to take more than two pills I'll have to quit. It's safe but not that safe.

column2: OTC_Meds_R_Bad_2, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I've been taking medication for sleep on & off for 20 years. THEY ALL CAN BE DANGEROUS & ALL ARE ADDICTING! With that said, I would never suggest anyone taking anything for sleep for more than 3 days UNLESS under the CONSTANT (weekly) care of a seasoned sleep professional that KNOWS that all of these medications have the potential to become addictive and can be dangerous. I've literally been to over 100 doctors and have even worked in the medical field as a Medical Assistant and know 1st and 2nd hand that these medications all are not good for you. Period. Especially if you have an addictive personality, drink alcohol or use street drugs, use herbs or other medications (including other antihistamines), have depression or ANY type of anxiety disorder. I HIGHLY recommened to NEVER get hooked on this! It's a nightmare trying to discontinue! I've gone through withdrawal from numerous medications (including Diphenhydramine, Ambien & Ambien CR, Lunesta, Xanax, Klonopin, ALL the SSRI Antidepressants, Effexor, Cymbalta, etc.) and must say this is no different than any of the meds I received from supposed professionals and colleagues. You WILL have withdrawal if you take this for possibly even as little as 3 days. Everyone's different so it's hard to say where each person's tolerance level stands. But please think about this: THESE MEDICATIONS CAN RUIN & RULE YOUR LIFE. They have mine for years and now I say no more! It's not only destroying me physically, but spiritually, emotionally, mentally, sexually, socially and carerr-wise as I can't hold a job because of the panic and anxiety this garbage causes when trying to get off of it. It's also caused serious distress to a once "picture perfect" marriage. This not only has made me miserable and sick all the time but it has affected everyone around me in some way because I'm a whole different person and can't remember anything. Also the panic attacks are wreaking havoc on out entire family. SO YES THIS IS HIGHLY ADDICTIVE & BAD

column2: Stylite, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took half a 25mg tablet and slept for 13 hours!  Too long!  It does make me groggy the next day, but overall I am so happy to have found something that works for me.  I was up at 4:30 every morning for the past six years.  It also helps my mood - almost instantaneously took away my crankiness and even though I was groggy the next day, I was also happy and mellow.  My dreams were really nice on it too.  I will try a a smaller dose next time.

column2: Joe, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The medication works well in putting me to sleep, but  the next day I am dumb as a post.  I can't think clearly and my reaction time is slow.

column2: Jim, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
Sophia, 35-44 Female  (Patient)
column9: Like many others here, I have tried all the prescription medicines like Ambien and Lunesta, and overall this simple OTC works just as well. It didn't knock me out like Ambien but helped me fall asleep naturally. I even take it sometimes for anxiety, since it totally relaxes me. I highly recommend it. For a while I also took some valerian herb with 1 tablet at bedtime. Best sleep I ever had !

column2: Peter, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medicine really works! As one with chronic insomnia, I've used every sleep aid over the course of the last 5 years (script or otherwise.) IMO, doxylamine works about as well as Lunesta, not as well as Ambien (but with far fewer side-effects) and better than Rozerem.  Another nice thing about doxylamine is that I ALWAYS sleep for a full 8 hours, with no early awakenings. As compared to the prescription sleep meds, doxylamine causes me little or no next-day tiredness. This was my primary complaint with Ambien and Lunesta. Doxylamine is also cheap and ubiquitous.If you or someone you know is suffering from long-term sleep problems, I strongly recommend having a sleep study.

column2: RAB, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Chronic sleep problems for years and I work shifts.  Doctor prescriped Lunesta.  That worked well for putting me to sleep, but would often awake after 2-3 hours of sleep and lay awake for 2-3 hours.  Felt awful the next day.  Doctor recommended trying Benedryl.  That and similar medications like Nytol leave me with a terrible hangover.  Tried doxylmaine succinate and so far it has solved the problem.  I use only a 1/2 pill or less.  What are the long term implications of its use?

column2: tony, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
mzulin, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: This is the only medication I have found to be effective for my severe allergies. The sedative side effect is easier to deal with than the hours of sneezing and misery. I only wonder why it isn't marketed as an antihistamine.

column2: nano, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I took this becuase I have trouble sleeping in motels.  I got WIRED!  I couldn't sleep for 5 hours.

column2: ANurse, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
Ellory, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I found this worked for my insomnia better than ambien (the ambien CR though is wonderful). I have to take one and a half tablets to feel a bit sleepy, although sometimes even that doesn't do it, but I haven't ever taken more.  If you have serious insomnia and are unresponsive to other medicines then one and a half tabs may work for you.  I do have a very hard time getting up in the a.m. after taking this and since I take it nightly I have done some research on the long term effects which of course, aren't good. It works well, but I need to break myself of this habit soon.

column2: Dr. CP, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have tried several other prescription sleeping pills and 1-2 tabs. work just as well and cost a fraction of the price of the more popular Rx. No problems following morning.

column2: MusicCan HelpYouHeal! ( Or your cat!), 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Have had trouble sleeping following mild stroke...this stuff is good... take 1/3 of the tablet, once took 1/4 and that was good too.  Cannot cut up any smaller...son has to do this for me! one person reviewing this took 1/8!  Cheers and sweet dreams!

column2: Harriette, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It took me 3 nights to figure out I just needed 1/3 of the pill to sleep all night and not feel sleepy the next day.  I absolutely love it. I have restless leg syndrome and ADHD so sleeping at night without meds is impossible.  I just hope there are no long term effects from using it every night.  Does anybody know if there are?

column2: casalvodds,  Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Caregiver)
column9: Leaves me with 1/2 next day  semi-groggy. I use only 1/8th of the tablet when needed. Very effective in producing sleep. History of children expiring on the full dose, esp babies in child care centers. It is a very powerful and effective drug when used correctly.

column2: RONA SMOKE, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I USE THIS TO SLEEP AND TO HELP WITH CHRONIC SKIN  ITCHING.  I ALWAYS FELT FINE IN THE MORNING AS LONG AS I TAKE IT EARLY ENOUGH.  USUALLY ABOUT 2 HOURS BEFORE GOING TO BED.IF I DON'T TAKE IT AND WAKE UP IN THE MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT I TRY TO AVOID IT OR TAKE JUST 1/2 DOSE.

column2: Periwink4, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Beware of the hangover effect! It works very well, however I could not take it on a work night! Maybe half the dose.

column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: if you need to get to sleep works very well no hang over feeling... very safe

column2: 45-54 Female
column9: I take only one half tab, so 12.5mg/night. Stress in my life has been at an all time high, but with this I become drowsy in about 15 minutes and sleep well through the night. No side effects in the a.m. I have never had to take a whole tab.I am an RN

column9: use of doxylamine succinate as a sleep aid is very effective, much more so than diphenhydramine. The only side effect is daytime drowsiness if I am not physically active.
